forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 52. West southwest wind around 12 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Monday
forecast.shortForecast: Chance Light Rain then Mostly Sunny
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain before 11am. Mostly sunny. High near 60, with temperatures falling to around 58 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 12 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the early hours greet Downtown San Francisco, the air carries a hint of moisture, an indication of the rain that may whisper upon the city's rooftops later tonight. Presently, a veil of clouds hangs over, creating a canvas that softens the surrounding skyline while allowing fragile glimpses of the urban landscape. Temperatures rest comfortably around fifty-two degrees, accompanied by a gentle west-southwest breeze that rustles leaves and invites one to wrap a light jacket around the shoulders. 

Looking ahead to the day, the promise of sun brightens the forecast, though a chance of morning rain lingers until the clock strikes eleven. In the afternoon, the sky will open into a charming expanse of blue, showering the streets with light and warmth as high temperatures strive to flirt with sixty. Yet with the winds maintaining their steady whisper, expect brief gusts that dance through the alleys, reminding us of the city’s capricious spirit. Dress in layers to savor the morning chill and greet the afternoon’s embrace, perhaps indulging in a leisurely stroll along the waterfront. Take a moment to savor coffee at a local café or peruse the treasures of a nearby market, where the sounds of conversation rise against the backdrop of buoyant optimism that the sun will soon fully claim the day.
